info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 4:31PM EST until January 09 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR CASWELL, EASTERN ROCKINGHAM AND PITTSYLVANIA COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF DANVILLE... At 431 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen since this morning, resulting in localized flash flooding of small creeks and streams. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area, particularly across Caswell County. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Danville... Eden... Reidsville... Altavista... Wentworth... Yanceyville... Bethel... This includes the following locations... Danville Airport. This includes the following streams and drainages... Allen Creek and Banister River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive around any barricades and obey any road closures.
